meanings.definition: The act of causing a train or tram to leave its tracks.
meanings.sent1: The derailment of the train was caused by a fallen tree on the tracks.
meanings.sent2: The railway workers quickly responded to the derailment and worked to clear the tracks.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's acorn rolling onto the train tracks led to the derailment - quite a nutty situation!
meanings.sent4: The derailment of the train symbolized the unexpected turns in life's journey.
meanings.sent5: The loud screech of metal during the derailment echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: The act of preventing a process or plan from continuing as expected.
meanings.sent1: The sudden budget cuts caused a derailment in the company's expansion plans.
meanings.sent2: The team worked together to avoid any derailment of the project timeline.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected power outage created a derailment in the otherwise smooth meeting.
meanings.sent4: Her absence was a derailment in the flow of the event, leaving everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent5: The last-minute change in venue resulted in a derailment of the original party plans.
